name: Pani Popo (Hawaiian Coconut Bread)
author: Kasey
summary: Delicious Hawaiian bread that anyone will love--even those who don't like coconut! Eat it for dessert or with any meat hot off the grill. Tastes great warm or cool.
ingredients: 1 (12 ounce) package frozen dinner rolls, thawed
¾ cup white sugar, or to taste
directions: Coat a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray
Coat your hands with cooking spray or shortening, and roll the dough balls in your hands so that they have a light coating
Set aside in a warm place to rise until doubled, up to 2 hours
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
In a small bowl, stir together the coconut milk, sweetened condensed milk and sugar
Pour this mixture over the top of the rolls as evenly as you can
Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, until golden brown
Let cool for a few minutes before separating and serving
